text:
Exam Focus
This topic review introduces macroeconomics and the measurement of aggregate
economic output. The crucial concepts to grasp here are aggregate demand, shortrun aggregate supply, and long-run aggregate supply. Know the factors that cause the
aggregate demand and supply curves to shift and the sources of long-run economic
growth. Understand the various measures of aggregate income (nominal and real GDP,
national income, personal income, and personal disposable income). The interaction
among saving, investment, the fiscal balance, and the trade balance will be built on in
the next Study Session on international trade and foreign exchange.
